pullRequest.title: [ML] Add per-partition categorization option
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds the initial Java side changes to enable
use of the per-partition categorization functionality
added in elastic/ml-cpp#1293.
There will be a followup change to complete the work,
as there cannot be any end-to-end integration tests
until elastic/ml-cpp#1293 is merged, and also
elastic/ml-cpp#1293 does not implement some of the
more peripheral functionality, like stop_on_warn and
per-partition stats documents.
The changes so far cover REST APIs, results object
formats, HLRC and docs.

commit.message:
[ML] Add per-partition categorization option

This PR adds the initial Java side changes to enable
use of the per-partition categorization functionality
added in elastic/ml-cpp#1293.

There will be a followup change to complete the work,
as there cannot be any end-to-end integration tests
until elastic/ml-cpp#1293 is merged, and also
elastic/ml-cpp#1293 does not implement some of the
more peripheral functionality, like stop_on_warn and
per-partition stats documents.

The changes so far cover REST APIs, results object
formats, HLRC and docs.

nodes.bodyText:
This setting may only be true if...

This sentence makes me wonder about things like this:

Is there a validation check that generates an error if this condition isn't met?
Does this mean that if you have a detector where the by_field_name or over_field_name contains mlcategory you must also specify a partition_field_name?  Or does this condition only apply if you already have a partition_field_name in that detector?
Depending on the answers to those questions, it might be clearer like this:


To enable this setting, you must also set the partition_field_name property to the same value in every detector that uses the keyword mlcategory. Otherwise, job creation fails.

nodes.bodyText:
where the categorization status changes to warn...

I don't think we talk anywhere else about when/why/where you'd see this status. Is this going to be added in a subsequent PR?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1113,6 +1113,27 @@ The field used to segment the analysis. When you use this property, you have
 completely independent baselines for each value of this field.
 end::partition-field-name[]
 
+tag::per-partition-categorization[]
+Settings related to how categorization interacts with partition fields.
+end::per-partition-categorization[]
+
+tag::per-partition-categorization-enabled[]
+If true, categorization is done separately for each value of the
+`partition_field_name` field. The default value is false. This setting can be
+set only when you create the job; it cannot be updated. This setting may only be
+true if every detector in the job that refers to `mlcategory` (the
+categorization output field) has the same value for `partition_field_name`.
+end::per-partition-categorization-enabled[]
+
+tag::per-partition-categorization-stop-on-warn[]
+This setting can be set to true only if per-partition categorization is enabled.
+If true, both categorization and subsequent anomaly detection stops for
+partitions where the categorization status changes to `warn`. This setting makes
